name: Puerta de la Ciudad
excerpt: With perhaps more pomp and circumstance than you'll encounter anywhere else in Loja, the City Gate greets you into downtown from the northern corner. It's…
detail_description:
With perhaps more pomp and circumstance than you'll encounter anywhere else in Loja, the City Gate greets you into downtown from the northern corner. It's a giant castle with an arched doorway spanning Sucre, a street forging south (from the confluence of Ríos Zamora and Malacatus) towards the central plazas.
Inside, the helpful staff, second-floor archaeological museum, cafe and several lookouts orchestrate an ideal intro to the city.

name: Parque Universitario PUEAR
excerpt: Almost 5km south of the center, the 90-hectare reserve has excellent trails. You’ll need to cab it here ($1.25).
detail_description: Almost 5km south of the center, the 90-hectare reserve has excellent trails. You’ll need to cab it here ($1.25).

name: Cathedral
excerpt: Watch the devotees stepping inside for their daily devotions to the Virgen del Cisne.
detail_description: Watch the devotees stepping inside for their daily devotions to the Virgen del Cisne.

name: Plaza San Francisco
excerpt: A block north of the Parque Central, this smallish plaza is crowned by a statue of the city’s founder astride his horse.
detail_description: A block north of the Parque Central, this smallish plaza is crowned by a statue of the city’s founder astride his horse.

name: Jardín Botánico Reinaldo Espinosa
excerpt: Across the road from the Parque Universitario, 5km south of the center, this botanical garden has nearly 900 plant species.
detail_description: Across the road from the Parque Universitario, 5km south of the center, this botanical garden has nearly 900 plant species.

name: Museo del Monasterio de Madres Concepcionistas
excerpt: A half-block east of Parque Central, this monastery has three public rooms housing religious treasures from the 16th to 18th centuries.
detail_description: A half-block east of Parque Central, this monastery has three public rooms housing religious treasures from the 16th to 18th centuries.

name: Parque La Banda/Orillas de Zamora
excerpt: North of town, this nice park has a small zoo and a beautifully designed Orquideario with over 200 species of orchids from southern Ecuador.
detail_description: North of town, this nice park has a small zoo and a beautifully designed Orquideario with over 200 species of orchids from southern Ecuador.

name: Plaza Santo Domingo
excerpt: Make a beeline a block south of Parque Central for this plaza, mainly notable for the Church of Santo Domingo, adorned with religious paintings.
detail_description: Make a beeline a block south of Parque Central for this plaza, mainly notable for the Church of Santo Domingo, adorned with religious paintings.

name: Plaza de la Independencia
excerpt: The plaza is hemmed in by the Church of San Sebastián and colonial-era buildings with pillared overhangs and shuttered wooden balconies. A brightly tiled…
detail_description: The plaza is hemmed in by the Church of San Sebastián and colonial-era buildings with pillared overhangs and shuttered wooden balconies. A brightly tiled fountain depicts Ecuadorian wildlife.

name: Calle Lourdes
excerpt: This narrow lane is the oldest colonial street in Loja. There are some nice art galleries here (if only the street were pedestrianized, they would be much…
detail_description: This narrow lane is the oldest colonial street in Loja. There are some nice art galleries here (if only the street were pedestrianized, they would be much more tempting to linger in).

name: Parque Central
excerpt: Loja’s main square is always busy with shoeshine boys, newspaper vendors and local devotees stepping into the cathedral for their daily devotions to the…
detail_description: Loja’s main square is always busy with shoeshine boys, newspaper vendors and local devotees stepping into the cathedral for their daily devotions to the Virgen del Cisne.

name: Parque Recreacional Jipiro
excerpt: North of town, this kid-friendly park offers a giant chessboard, a skate park, a Chinese pagoda, a pint-size Kremlin, small animal enclosures and a…
detail_description: North of town, this kid-friendly park offers a giant chessboard, a skate park, a Chinese pagoda, a pint-size Kremlin, small animal enclosures and a paddleboat pond. Green buses ($0.25) go there from the southeast corner of Eguiguren and Peña.

name: Museo de la Cultura Lojana
excerpt: On the south side of Parque Central, a characterful republican-era building houses this museum and its exhibits, which include good local art, archaeology…
detail_description: On the south side of Parque Central, a characterful republican-era building houses this museum and its exhibits, which include good local art, archaeology and ethnography. Most interesting are the old photographs of Loja and the room devoted to the Saraguro culture.

name: Mirador Teléferico
excerpt: Loja's best viewpoint is at the top of the cable car from Parque Pucará, 1km south of Plaza de la Independencia up Olmedo. Walk or get a taxi ($1) to the…
detail_description: Loja's best viewpoint is at the top of the cable car from Parque Pucará, 1km south of Plaza de la Independencia up Olmedo. Walk or get a taxi ($1) to the cable car base. Tourist robberies have happened on the trail which goes up from the park, so taking the cable car, and not taking valuables, is recommended.

name: Museo de la Música
excerpt: This fun museum located in an old school explores the lives of famous musicians who hailed from Loja (most peaking in success during the golden 1890–1940…
detail_description: This fun museum located in an old school explores the lives of famous musicians who hailed from Loja (most peaking in success during the golden 1890–1940 period). Many old instruments and scores of music are on display, and a shop here (often closed) sells music.
